A UN investigative committee now says that UN security mismanagement was responsible for the bombing of the UN's Iraq office and death of 22 people. The office refused protective window film from a UN-affiliated agency and also refused any type of US security measures. They asked the US to remove a vehicle blocking a road to the office that the bomber later used to drive right into the office.
 
 On another note, the dying wish of the UN's top officer in Iraq have been ignored as the UN has pulled out almost all of it's personnel.
 
 What makes people think that blue helmets, only required to have a gun and bullet proof vests, will do any better than US forces?

They asked the US to remove a vehicle blocking a road to the office that the bomber later used to drive right into the office.
 
 On another note, the dying wish of the UN's top officer in Iraq have been ignored as the UN has pulled out almost all of it's personnel.
 
 What makes people think that blue helmets, only required to have a gun and bullet proof vests, will do any better than US forces?

 
 Not me. If the UN were smart they would stay out of there. But the UN is not, and that is another reason we should get out of the UN.

I agree. The UN has gone too far... it was one thing to have Libya, Cuba, Sudan, and Zimbabwe monitoring human rights. It's another for the UN to go on the offensive, demand a large role, and pull out what little they had there.

Not me. If the UN were smart they would stay out of there. But the UN is not, and that is another reason we should get out of the UN.

 
 But than again you also think that you're own government should get out of itself as well.
